page.title: 09Surrey University in space
page.content: The Uosat satellite project is run by the Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering at{Surrey {University.}It is unique to a British university.{Uosat 1}was launched in 1981 by NASA from a base in California. It is now in orbit at 510 km. circling the Earth every ninety five minutes. The main aim is to provide scientists with a tool to study the {electromagnetic and geomagnetic {environment}of near Earth. The project is also of use to amateur space enthusiasts. {Uosat 2}was launched in 1984 again by NASA. Through these two satellites it will be possible to examine the feasability of low cost spacecraft and their contribution to science. Both satellites remain fully operatinal and well used.
